name: Complete Workflow Provenance Trace
abstract: Master profile combining Research Object, Workflow Description, and Workflow Execution Provenance

sources.title: CWLProv - Provenance profiles for Common Workflow Language

description:
## Description

This master profile combines all elements of the Wf4Ever ontology suite to represent a complete workflow provenance trace:

- **Research Object (RO)**: Container aggregating all workflow-related resources
- **Workflow Description (WFDESC)**: Prospective provenance - the workflow structure and specification
- **Workflow Execution (WFPROV)**: Retrospective provenance - the actual execution trace

This building block demonstrates the full integration of:
1. Workflow structure (inputs, outputs, steps)
2. Execution trace (runs, artifacts, agents)
3. Research object packaging (aggregation, annotations, manifest)

## Purpose

This profile serves multiple purposes:
- **Validation**: End-to-end test of the complete Wf4Ever model
- **Documentation**: Demonstrates how all pieces fit together
- **Interoperability**: Shows mapping to PROV-O and other standards
- **Real-world example**: Based on actual CWLProv data from scientific workflows

## Use Cases

1. **Scientific Workflow Archival**: Package complete workflow execution for reproducibility
2. **Provenance Tracking**: Track data lineage from input to output through workflow steps
3. **Workflow Sharing**: Share not just the workflow definition, but execution traces and results
4. **Compliance**: Meet FAIR data principles with complete provenance metadata

## Structure

A complete provenance trace contains:

```
Research Object
├── Manifest (describes RO)
├── Workflow (wfdesc:Workflow)
│   ├── Inputs (wfdesc:Input)
│   ├── Outputs (wfdesc:Output)
│   └── Processes (wfdesc:Process)
├── WorkflowRun (wfprov:WorkflowRun)
│   ├── Used (input artifacts)
│   ├── Generated (output artifacts)
│   ├── wasAssociatedWith (agents/engines)
│   └── ProcessRuns (sub-executions)
└── Annotations (metadata, attributions)
```

## Mapping to Standards

- **PROV-O**: WorkflowRun → prov:Activity, Artifacts → prov:Entity
- **DCAT**: Research Object → dcat:Dataset
- **OGC API Processes**: Workflow → Process description
- **ORE**: Research Object uses ORE aggregation model
